Module assegnamento2.assegnamento2
Package assegnamento2.assegnamento2.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
assegnamento2.assegnamento2.controller.Controller
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientController, EmployeeController, LoginController, RegisterController
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class represent the controller superclass where there are methods and functions used by the EmployeeController/ClientController/AdminController subclasses

  • Method Details

    • loginR

      public Boolean loginR(String userName) throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXException, IOException
      This method is used to see if in the registration phase the username that the client has entered already exists or not.
      Parameters:
      userName - It is the username of the client who is trying to register.
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value: true : if the username already exists ; false : if the username does not exist.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
      ParserConfigurationException - Indicates a serious configuration error.
      SAXException - Encapsulate a general SAX error or warning.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(Object user) throws XMLStreamException, IOException, ParserConfigurationException, SAXException
      This method is used to insert/add in the DB.xml file the user type specified by the parameter
      Parameters:
      user - It is the type of the passed object which can be Admin/Employee/Client.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - is used to report well-formedness errors as well as unexpected processing conditions.
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
      ParserConfigurationException - Indicates a serious configuration error.
      SAXException - Encapsulate a general SAX error or warning.

    • writerNode

      private void writerNode(String[] n, XMLStreamWriter writer, String s, NodeList nodeList) throws XMLStreamException
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException

    • refreshEmp

      public void refreshEmp(List<Employee> empList) throws XMLStreamException, IOException, ParserConfigurationException, SAXException
      This method is used to update/write the DB.xml file, more specifically it updates/write the employees that are in the file thanks to a support list empList where there are all the existing employees.
      Parameters:
      empList - It is the Employee's list.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - is used to report well-formedness errors as well as unexpected processing conditions.
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
      ParserConfigurationException - Indicates a serious configuration error.
      SAXException - Encapsulate a general SAX error or warning.

    • refreshList

      public void refreshList(List<ElettronicDevice> list, String src) throws XMLStreamException, FileNotFoundException
      This method is used to update/write the xml file,thanks to a support list.
      Parameters:
      list - It is support ElettronicDevice list
      src - It is the xml file, to make it work you must put the absolute path.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - is used to report well-formedness errors as well as unexpected processing conditions.
      FileNotFoundException - reports that an attempt to open the file indicated by a specified path name has failed.

    • writerElement

      protected void writerElement(String string, XMLStreamWriter writer, Element element) throws XMLStreamException
      This method is used to write to an xml file by passing it certain parameters.
      Parameters:
      string - It is the string that represent the tag in the xml file.
      writer - It is the XMLStreamWriter interface which is able to write to an xml file.
      element - It is the Element interface which is able to write in node(element) to an xml file.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - is used to report well-formedness errors as well as unexpected processing conditions.

    • writerElement

      protected void writerElement(String string, XMLStreamWriter writer, String element) throws XMLStreamException
      This method is used to write to an xml file by passing it certain parameters.
      Parameters:
      string - It is the string that represent the tag in the xml file.
      writer - It is the XMLStreamWriter interface which is able to write to an xml file.
      element - It is the String which is able to write in node(element) to an xml file.
      Throws:
      XMLStreamException - is used to report well-formedness errors as well as unexpected processing conditions.

    • readElDev

      public void readElDev(List<ElettronicDevice> list, String src) throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXException, IOException
      This method is used to read the various elements that are inside an xml file, thanks to the use of a support list.
      Parameters:
      list - It is the support ElettronicDevice list.
      src - It is the xml file, to make it work you must put the absolute path.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
      ParserConfigurationException - Indicates a serious configuration error.
      SAXException - Encapsulate a general SAX error or warning.

    • printListFX

      public void printListFX(javafx.scene.control.TableView tableView, Object listProduct)
      This method is used to print a list in the graphical interface by using the TableView class.
      Parameters:
      tableView - It is the name of the TableView in the appropriate fxml file.
      listProduct - It is the list you want to print in the graphical interface.

    • popUp

      public void popUp(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType alertType, String text, String header)
      This method is used to make an alert (pop up) appear, different according to the needs, in the graphic interface.
      Parameters:
      alertType - It is the Alert object.
      text - It is the text that appears inside the alert.
      header - It is the header that appears inside the alert.

    • handleHomeButton

      public void handleHomeButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method is used to manage the login button in the Register.fxml file registration scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that causes the scene change.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

    • changeScene

      public void changeScene(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, String fxml, String title) throws IOException
      This method is used to change the scene whenever it is needed by passing parameters.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that causes the scene change.
      fxml - It is the fxml file, basically it is the destination of the scene change.
      title - It is the title of the scene.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
